sect1.title: all
sect1.para: Execute the specified SQL against all the current connections.

example.title: Example of "all" command
example.screen:
1: jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild> !list
2 active connections: #0 open jdbc:oracle:thin:@10.0.0.50:1521:ora92 #1 open jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild?autoReconnect=true
1: jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild> !all DELETE FROM COMPANY;
Executing SQL against: jdbc:oracle:thin:@10.0.0.50:1521:ora92 4 rows affected (0.004 seconds)
Executing SQL against: jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild 1 row affected (3.187 seconds)
1: jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild>

sect1.title: autocommit
sect1.para: Set autocommit mode on or off. When autocommit is on, then every individual SQL statement will be committed after it is issued. Otherwise, the commit command will need to be issued in order to commit any changed to the database.

example.title: Example of "autocommit" command
example.screen:
1: jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild> !autocommit off
Autocommit status: false
1: jdbc:mysql://10.0.0.2/jdoautobuild>

sect1.title: batch
sect1.para: Start or execute a batch of SQL statements. The first time the statement is issued, subsequent SQL statements will be deferred until the batch command is issued again. Databases can frequently optimize multiple batched statements (e.g., for bulk data loading) in order to speed up execution.

example.title: Example of "batch" command
example.screen:
0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> !batch
Batching SQL statements. Run "batch" again to execute the batch.
0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (1); 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (2); 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (3); 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (4); 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> !batch
Running batched SQL statements... COUNT STATEMENT 1 INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (1) 1 INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (2) 1 INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (3) 1 INSERT INTO MYTABLE (ID) VALUES (4)
0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> SELECT * FROM MYTABLE;
+-----+ | ID | +-----+ | 1 | | 2 | | 3 | | 4 | +-----+ 4 rows selected (0.012 seconds) 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb>

sect1.para: Close the current connection and remote it from the connection list.

1 active connection: #0 open jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb

sqlline> !list
No active connections
sqlline>

sect1.title: columns
sect1.para: List the columns in the specified table.

sect1.title: commit
sect1.para: Commit the current transaction, if autocommit is off.

example.screen:

Autocommit status: false

Commit complete (0.661 seconds)

sect1.para: List all the indexes on the specified table name.

sect1.para: Set the isolation level for the current transaction. For a description of the different isolation levels, see http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/api/java/sql/Connection.html#field_detail.

0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb>

sect1.title: metadata
sect1.para: Execute an arbitrary metadata method agains the current connection. Parameters are separated by spaces. Use "" for a blank String, and null for a null parameter. For information on available metadata methods, see http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/api/java/sql/DatabaseMetaData.html.

sect1.title: outputformat
sect1.para: Set the mode for displaying results from statements. This is useful for saving output from SQL statements to either a visually pleasing format or an easily parseable format.

example.title: Example of table output formatting
example.screen: 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> !outputformat table 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> SELECT * FROM COMPANY; +-------------+------------+ | COMPANY_ID | NAME | +-------------+------------+ | 1 | Apple | | 2 | Sun | | 3 | IBM | | 4 | Microsoft | +-------------+------------+ 4 rows selected (0.012 seconds)

example.title: Example of vertical output formatting
example.screen:
0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> !outputformat vertical 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> SELECT * FROM COMPANY; COMPANY_ID 1 NAME Apple
COMPANY_ID 2 NAME Sun
COMPANY_ID 3 NAME IBM
COMPANY_ID 4 NAME Microsoft
4 rows selected (0.011 seconds)

example.title: Example of CSV output formatting
example.screen: 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> !outputformat csv 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> SELECT * FROM COMPANY; 'COMPANY_ID','NAME' '1','Apple' '2','Sun' '3','IBM' '4','Microsoft' 4 rows selected (0.012 seconds)

example.title: Example of TSV output formatting
example.screen: 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> !outputformat tsv 0: jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:mydb> SELECT * FROM COMPANY; 'COMPANY_ID' 'NAME' '1' 'Apple' '2' 'Sun' '3' 'IBM' '4' 'Microsoft' 4 rows selected (0.013 seconds)

sect1.title: rehash
sect1.para: Get a list of all tables and columns from the database in order to include them in the list for tab-completion of SQL statements. This is done automatically on connect when the fastconnect option is enabled.

caution.para: This operation can be extremely slow for some databases.
